purpleculture_pinyin:
dìng
to join things together by fixing them in place at one or more points; to nail; to pin; to staple; to sew on
соединять вещи вместе, фиксируя их на месте в одной или нескольких точках; прибить; приколоть; сшивать; пришить

dīng
nail; to follow closely; to keep at sb (to do sth); variant of 盯
гвоздь; внимательно следить; to keep at sb (делать что-то); вариант 盯

Kanshudo_mnemonic: a block (丁) of gold (金) makes a nail
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: A golden nails is totally better than a normal metal one.
humanum_full_description_en:
From " gold " to " ding " sound. The original meaning is to chain gold into a pie shape. "Said Wen": "Nail, chain hawk gold. From gold, Ding Sheng." Niu Shuyu said that "鉼" is also " cake ". Duan Yucai's note: "All things plaques are called cakes. Chain cakes are made from chains." Zhang Shunhui's note: "Chain cakes are called nails, and they can fill up the shoes. They are all called vertebral strikes. ."

After " nail ", it often means a nail, that is, a slender tool made of bamboo, wood or metal, with a sharp end, which is mainly used for fixing or connecting. Such as "Three Kingdoms. Wei Shu. "The Legend of Han Tian Qian Guo": "The thief wants to dig the coffin and take the nails, please forgive me if you cry." "Founder" quoted "Wei Lue": "(Wang) Ling convicted himself of a serious crime and tried to find the coffin nails to see the Taifu's intention, and the Taifu gave it."

" Nail " also means to nail something with a nail, which means hammering a nail into something else. Such as "Hou Han Shu. "Biography of Huangfu Zhang Duan": "But the underground is dark, and there is no daylight, and the complex winding is lenient, and the nail is tight, which is not happy." Bei Zhou Yuxin "Looking with Zhao Wang": "Twisting Bell grid, round flower nail drum bed."

The extension of " nail " means a spike-shaped bump. For example, Mei Yaochen of the Northern Song Dynasty "He answered Han Fenglizhi": "Puyang dried lychees, wrinkled shells and red nails." Chapter 34 of the "Water Margin": "Sitting down on a horse is like a hachi, with a mace inlaid with copper nails. When you are angry, your eyes will widen."

" Nail " means stitching . For example, "The Scholars" Chapter 25: "Father Wang was extremely happy with Bao Tingxi, and he took out a big red satin and gold threaded banknote bag with an ingot of silver in it, and gave it to him." 22nd of "Heroes of Children" Reply: "First, drawing and tailoring, nailing buttons, is a job, he doesn't know how to do it."

" Nailing " is the same as " staring ", which means looking straight and watching. For example, Chapter 24 of "Dream of Red Mansions": "The girl heard that she knew that she was the man of her own family, so she didn't evade like she did before and nailed Jia Yun with a dead eye." He pointed again. For example, Chapter 8 of "The Officialdom": "The new sister-in-law sent a little eldest sister to the stack to pin him, and told him to go, but he refused to go."
humanum_short_description_en: From " gold " to " ding " sound. The original meaning is to chain gold into a pie shape. The latter mostly means nails, and also means nailing objects with nails.
humanum_full_description:
從「金」，「丁」聲。本義是把黃金鍊成餅形。《說文》：「釘，鍊鉼黃金。从金，丁聲。」鈕樹玉謂「鉼」亦作「餅」。段玉裁注：「凡物匾之曰餅。鍊餅，鍊而成之。」張舜徽約注：「鍊餅金謂之釘，猶補履下謂之靪，皆謂椎擊之丁丁有聲也。」

　　「釘」後多表示釘子，即竹木或金屬製成的細長工具，一端尖銳，主要用作固定或連接。如《三國志．魏書．漢田牽郭傳》：「賊欲斫棺取釘，招垂淚請赦。」《世說新語．方正》引《魏略》：「（王）凌自知罪重，試索棺釘，以觀太傅意，太傅給之。」

　　「釘」也表示用釘子釘物，意謂把釘子錘打進別的東西中。如《後漢書．皇甫張段列傳》：「但地底冥冥，長無曉期，而復纏以纊綿，牢以釘密，為不喜耳。」北周庾信〈和趙王看伎〉：「細縷纏鐘格，圓花釘鼓床。」

　　「釘」引申表示釘狀的隆起物。如北宋梅堯臣〈和答韓奉禮餉荔枝〉：「莆陽荔子乾，皺殼紅釘密。」《水滸全傳》第34回：「坐下馬如同獬豸，狼牙棒密嵌銅釘，怒時兩目便圓睜。」

　　「釘」表示縫綴。如《儒林外史》第25回：「王老爹極其歡喜鮑廷璽，拿出一個大紅緞子釘金線的鈔袋來，裏頭裝着一錠銀子，送與他。」《兒女英雄傳》第22回：「第一，描畫剪裁，扎拉釘扣，是個活計兒，他沒有不會的。」

　　「釘」同「盯」，表示直視、注視。如《紅樓夢》第24回：「那丫頭聽說，方知是本家的爺們，便不似先前那等回避，下死眼把賈芸釘了兩眼。」又指緊跟著。如《官場現形記》第8回：「新嫂嫂派了一個小大姐到棧裏釘住他，叫他去，他不肯去。」
humanum_short_description: 從「金」，「丁」聲。本義是把黃金鍊成餅形。後多表示釘子，也表示用釘子釘物。

從「 金 」，「 丁 」聲。本義是把黃金鍊成餅形。《說文》：「釘，鍊鉼黃金。从金，丁聲。」鈕樹玉謂「 鉼 」亦作「 餅 」。段玉裁注：「凡物匾之曰餅。鍊餅，鍊而成之。」張舜徽約注：「鍊餅金謂之釘，猶補履下謂之靪，皆謂椎擊之丁丁有聲也。」 「 釘 」後多表示釘子，即竹木或金屬製成的細長工具，一端尖銳，主要用作固定或連接。如《三國志．魏書．漢田牽郭傳》：「賊欲斫棺取釘，招垂淚請赦。」《世說新語．方正》引《魏略》：「（王）凌自知罪重，試索棺釘，以觀太傅意，太傅給之。」 「 釘 」也表示用釘子釘物，意謂把釘子錘打進別的東西中。如《後漢書．皇甫張段列傳》：「但地底冥冥，長無曉期，而復纏以纊綿，牢以釘密，為不喜耳。」北周庾信〈和趙王看伎〉：「細縷纏鐘格，圓花釘鼓床。」 「 釘 」引申表示釘狀的隆起物。如北宋梅堯臣〈和答韓奉禮餉荔枝〉：「莆陽荔子乾，皺殼紅釘密。」《水滸全傳》第34回：「坐下馬如同獬豸，狼牙棒密嵌銅釘，怒時兩目便圓睜。」 「 釘 」表示縫綴。如《儒林外史》第25回：「王老爹極其歡喜鮑廷璽，拿出一個大紅緞子釘金線的鈔袋來，裏頭裝着一錠銀子，送與他。」《兒女英雄傳》第22回：「第一，描畫剪裁，扎拉釘扣，是個活計兒，他沒有不會的。」 「 釘 」同「 盯 」，表示直視、注視。如《紅樓夢》第24回：「那丫頭聽說，方知是本家的爺們，便不似先前那等回避，下死眼把賈芸釘了兩眼。」又指緊跟著。如《官場現形記》第8回：「新嫂嫂派了一個小大姐到棧裏釘住他，叫他去，他不肯去。」

Duan Yucai's note: "All things plaques are called cakes. Chain cakes are made from chains." Zhang Shunhui's note: "Chain cakes are called nails, and they can fill up the shoes. They are all called vertebral strikes. ." After " nail", it often means a nail, that is, a slender tool made of bamboo, wood or metal, with a sharp end, which is mainly used for fixing or connecting. Such as "Three Kingdoms. Wei Shu. "The Legend of Han Tian Qian Guo": "The thief wants to dig the coffin and take the nails, please forgive me if you cry." "Founder" quoted "Wei Lue": "(Wang) Ling convicted himself of a serious crime and tried to find the coffin nails to see the Taifu's intention, and the Taifu gave it." " Nail" also means to nail something with a nail, which means hammering a nail into something else. Such as "Hou Han Shu. "Biography of Huangfu Zhang Duan": "But the underground is dark, and there is no daylight, and the complex winding is lenient, and the nail is tight, which is not happy." For example, Mei Yaochen of the Northern Song Dynasty "He answered Han Fenglizhi": "Puyang dried lychees, wrinkled shells and red nails." For example, "The Scholars" Chapter 25: "Father Wang was extremely happy with Bao Tingxi, and he took out a big red satin and gold threaded banknote bag with an ingot of silver in it, and gave it to him." 22nd of "Heroes of Children" Reply: "First, drawing and tailoring, nailing buttons, is a job, he doesn't know how to do it." For example, Chapter 24 of "Dream of Red Mansions": "The girl heard that she knew that she was the man of her own family, so she didn't evade like she did before and nailed Jia Yun with a dead eye." 釘字的基本解释

釘
dīng

釘
dìng
均见“钉”。

釘字的汉语字典释义

[①]［dīng］
［《廣韻》當經切，平青，端。］
“钉1”的繁体字。
(1)钉子。用以贯物使坚固，其质金属，或竹木。
(2)隆起物，钉状物。
(3)盯。专注地看；注视。
(4)紧跟；监视。
(5)催促；紧逼。
(6)叮。蚊子等昆虫螫刺。
(7)灯。
(8)通“”。参见“釘明釭”。
(9)通“飣”。参见“釘果盤”。
[②]［dìng］
［《廣韻》丁定切，去徑，端。］
“钉2”的繁体字。
(1)以钉钉物。
(2)以锐器刺入。
(3)缝缀。
(4)用同“頂”。
(5)固定。
(6)通“訂”。参见“釘2銓”。

釘字的康熙字典解释

【戌集上】【金字部】　釘； 康熙笔画：10； 页码：页1296第03
【唐韻】【集韻】【韻會】【正韻】?當經切，音丁。【說文】鍊鉼黃金。　又【正韻】鈴釘，矛名。【郭璞曰】鶴厀矛，江東呼爲鈴釘。一曰鐵釴。　又【正韻】鐵釘。又【晉書·陶侃傳】竹頭木屑，悉令掌之，及桓溫伐蜀，以所貯竹頭，作釘裝船。　又國名。【山海經】有釘靈之國。【註】吳任臣云：釘靈，今丁靈國。又名丁令。亦作丁零。　又【抱朴子·黃白卷】光明美色，可中釘也。　又【集韻】都挺切，音頂。【前漢·王子侯者年表】有利侯劉釘。【註】音丁。又音鼎。　又【集韻】煉鉼金。　又【廣韻】【集韻】【韻會】【正韻】?丁定切，音矴。義同。　又【增韻】以釘釘物也。　又【五音集韻】郞丁切，音靈。【字類】撞?。

釘字的源字形

字源演变：

小篆楷体

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体香港明体日本明朝体韩国明朝体旧字形
釘字的起名意思

暂无。

nail
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［dīng］
["Guangyun" should be cut through, flat green, end. ]
Traditional Chinese characters for "针1".
(1) Nails. Used to penetrate objects to make it strong, the quality of metal, or bamboo and wood.
(2) Protrusions, spikes.
(3) Stare. Watch intently; watch.
(4) Follow closely; monitor.
(5) Urging; pressing.
(6) Ding. Mosquitoes and other insects sting.
(7) Lights.
(8) Through "". See "Ding Mingyan".
(9) Through "饤". See "nailed fruit plate".
[②]［dìng］
["Guang Yun" Ding Ding cut, go to the path, end. ]
Traditional Chinese characters for "针2".
(1) Nail things.
(2) Pierce with a sharp object.
(3) Stitching.
(4) Use the same as "top".
(5) Fixed.
(6) Through "subscription". See "Ding 2 Quan".
nail
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
【Su Ji 1】【Golden Word Department】　Ding; Kangxi Strokes: 10; Page Number: Page 1296 No. 03
[Tang Yun] [Ji Yun] [Rhyme Meeting] [Zheng Yun]? When the scriptures are cut, the sound is Ding. [Said the text] Chain 鉼 gold.　[Zheng Yun] Bell nail, spear name. [Guo Pu said] Crane's spear, Jiang Dong called the bell nail. One said Tie Yan.　[Zheng Yun] Nails. Also [Book of Jin·Tao Kan Biography] Bamboo head sawdust, Xi Lingzhangzhi, and Huan Wen cut Shu, and the stored bamboo heads are used as nails to ship.　 Also the name of the country. [Shan Hai Jing] There is a country of nailing spirits. [Note] Wu Renchenyun: Nail Ling, now Ding Lingguo. Also known as Ding Ling. Also known as Ding Ling.　[Baopuzi·Huangbaijuan] Bright and beautiful, but also nailed.　[Jiyun] are quite cut, and the sound is at the top. [Chronology of former Han·Princes] Liu Ding Lihou. [Note] Yinding. You Yinding.　[Jiyun] refining gold.　 [Guang Yun] [Ji Yun] [Rhyme Meeting] [Zheng Yun]? Ding Dingqie, the sound is awkward. The same meaning.　[Zeng Yun] To nail things.　[Five Tone Collection Rhyme] Yin Dingqie, sound and spirit. 【Types】Bump?.
